story:
Once upon a time, in a small village in Nigeria, there was a kind and curious little girl named Ada. Ada loved to explore the world around her and ask questions about everything she saw. She was especially fascinated by the animals that lived in the forest near her home.

One day, Ada decided to go on a journey to find the rarest and most beautiful animal in the forest. She packed a small bag with some food and water, put on her favorite dress, and set off into the woods.

As she walked deeper into the forest, Ada encountered many different animals. She saw monkeys swinging from tree to tree, brightly colored butterflies flitting about, and even a family of elephants trumpeting in the distance.

But Ada was determined to find the rarest and most beautiful animal of all. She continued on her journey, following a winding path deeper into the heart of the forest.

Finally, after many hours of walking, Ada stumbled upon a clearing where she saw the most beautiful animal she had ever laid eyes on. It was a majestic creature with a shimmering golden mane and piercing blue eyes. It was the legendary African lion, known for its grace and power.

Ada was awestruck by the sight of the magnificent beast, and she slowly approached it, hoping to get a closer look. But as she approached, the lion began to growl and bare its teeth. Ada realized that she had gotten too close and quickly retreated.

Just as she was turning to leave, the lion spoke to her. "Why have you come to my forest, little one?" it asked.

Ada was surprised to hear the lion speak, but she gathered her courage and replied, "I have come to find the rarest and most beautiful animal in the forest, and I believe I have found it in you."

The lion smiled. "You are a wise and brave girl," it said. "But do not be fooled by appearances. It is not always the most beautiful or powerful creatures that are the rarest or the most worthy of admiration. It is those who are kind, compassionate, and true to themselves."

Ada thought about the lion's words and realized that they were true. She thanked the lion for its wisdom and promised to always be kind, compassionate, and true to herself.

From that day on, Ada became a beloved member of her village, known for her kindness and wisdom. And she always remembered the lesson she learned in the forest that day, that true beauty and rarity come from within.

And with that, my dear daughter, it is time for you to close your eyes and drift off to sleep, knowing that you too are a rare and beautiful soul, loved and cherished by all who know you. Goodnight.
